page.title: 12TRADE IN ST. TEATH
page.content: DESPITE THE RECENT GROWTH IN POPULATION, THERE HAS BEEN A DECLINE IN THE NUMBER AND QUALITY OF SERVICES AND AMENITIES IN THE VILLAGE. THIRTY YEARS AGO ST. TEATH BOASTED TWO GENERAL STORES, TWO SHOEMAKERS, A NEWSAGENT, A BUTCHER, A FISHMONGER, A CO-OP STORE, A BARBER, A MILLINER, A BLACKSMITH, A GARAGE AND PETROL STATION AND A BAKERS ROUND THREE TIMES A WEEK. NOW THERE ARE ONLY FOUR SHOPS; THE POST OFFICE AND GENERAL STORES; NEWSAGENT AND GREENGROCER; A BUTCHER AND CONFECTIONER. THE GARAGE NO LONGER SELLS PETROL AND THE BAKER COMES ONLY ONCE A WEEK. NEVERTHELESS, ALTHOUGH ACCESS TO THE BIGGER STORES IN NEIGHBOURING TOWNS IS NOW POSSIBLE BY LOCAL BUS SERVICES, MOST VILLAGERS PREFER TO DO THEIR SHOPPING IN ST.TEATH WHERE PERSONAL SERVICE AND FRIENDLINESS ARE MUCH APPRECIATED.
